parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A robber, brigand, bandit. From leizomai; a brigand.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To crucify together with. From sun and stauroo; to impale in company with.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.
